summary: This bill, HR 5704, aims to repeal the Smith-Mundt Modernization Act of 2013 and prohibit domestic propagandization by the Federal Government. It amends the United States Information and Educational Exchange Act of 1948 to restrict domestic dissemination of materials produced for foreign audiences. It also reinforces the ban on using funds to influence U.S. public opinion and clarifies exceptions for providing factual information about government operations. The bill mandates archival practices and outlines guidelines for public access after a 20-year period.
